meanings.definition: A woman who has lost her spouse by death and has not remarried.
meanings.sent1: The widows gathered to support each other during their time of loss.
meanings.sent2: She became one of the widows after her husband passed away.
meanings.sent3: The widows shared stories of their late husbands, finding comfort in memories.
meanings.sent4: The town felt like a widow, mourning the loss of its beloved mayor.
meanings.sent5: The image of the lonely widow sitting by the window stayed with him for days.

meanings.definition: To deprive of a spouse by death.
meanings.sent1: The war widows struggled to rebuild their lives after losing their partners.
meanings.sent2: He widows many families when he takes their loved ones away.
meanings.sent3: The storm seemed to widow the small village, leaving many without their spouses.
meanings.sent4: The loss of the king widows the kingdom, leaving it vulnerable.
meanings.sent5: The accident widows the young woman, changing her life forever.
